name: AHAB
description: Named after one of the first recorded megafauna hunters in Cradle’s history, the Ahab is a venerable design that has seen widespread and varied use on a plethora of worlds -- though none more so than Sparr, home to the famed hunters that carry on the ancient sailor’s heritage. Captain Ahab’s biography, titled simply The Whale, was one of the many examples of ancient Cradle literature carried on the Yggdrasil, and understandably one the Sparri people took to heart upon settling their new world. The canon of the Pequod, Ahab’s hunting vessel, has since been expanded over the millennia, giving rise to many fantastical stories far divorced from the original’s realistic tone, save for the presence of gigantic beasts menacing the sea and shore, requiring steely resolve and a sharp harpoon to dispatch.

traits.name: Whaler
traits.description: If a target is at least 1 size larger than the Ahab (without rounding), it makes all attacks against that target at an amount of Accuracy equal to the difference in their sizes (Maximum 3). All Hull Saves the Ahab forces on the target are made at an equal amount of difficulty.

traits.name: High Test Line
traits.description: The Ahab counts as Size 3 when inflicting forced movement. 1/round, the Ahab may pull an Immobilized character within Range 10 up to 3 spaces towards it as a Free Action.

traits.name: Slow
traits.description: The Ahab has +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Ahab receives +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

core_system.name: Retiarian Electromag Net
core_system.description: In the summer months on Sparr, local fish are abundant among the icemelt waterways. Such is a time of relative abundance, with fisheries and canneries springing to life in the relatively temperate conditions. One such tool is the rete, a deceptively sophisticated net of collapsible recursive fiber that can expand to cover entire river-mouths with the application of electrical current. When desired, the net’s circular floats can emit an electromagnetic pull, clamping together as the net shrinks back down, compacting around and trapping whatever unlucky prey is inside. While not quite big enough to totally envelop a mechanized chassis, the rete’s electrical properties nevertheless make it ideal for tripping up and frustrating the movements of hostile armor.
core_system.active_effect: Target a Blast 1 area within Range 10 and Line of Sight. All characters within it are affected as though they were hit by your Ensnare and reeled in until one of them is adjacent to you. This is a separate effect to Ensnare and does not interfere with that action’s effects.
core_system.passive_effect: Gain the Throw The Net Quick Action.

passive_actions.name: Throw The Net
passive_actions.detail: Make a Ranged Attack against a target within Range and Line of Sight. On a success, that target is Immobilized and their Evasion cannot be higher than 5 until they escape the net by making a Hull Save as a Full Action. You can only have one character Ensnared at a time -- using this action while you already have an Ensnared target ends the effect on that target.

name: CHING SHIH
description: Often, it is impossible for a mech design to spring, fully-formed, from a single independent contractor’s mind. While such “garage mechs” are plentiful, they are often severely flawed or overengineered such that no sane manufacturer would buy its licensing rights. These mechs are often a line of one, and are either destroyed in their first sortie or miraculous victors by virtue of their creator-pilots’ lavish attention and care. Such is the case with the Ching Shih. Inspired by the sight of a garbage skip filled with beverage cans, the Ching Shih was devoted from its inception to mount, print, and fire more missiles per second than even the famous SSC Monarch. While certain anatomical compromises must be made to allow such massive missile batteries to exist, the Ching Shih has the honor of being one of the few “garage mechs” to be inducted into IPS-Northstar’s auxiliary support catalogue.

traits.name: Multitudinous Missiles
traits.description: The Ching Shih has a Munitions Die, a d6, which starts at 1. Every time the Ching Shih fires a Launcher, it increases the value of its Munitions Die by 1. When the Munitions Die is at 6, the Ching Shih may reset it to 1 when it fires a Launcher to fire that Launcher again.

traits.name: Radar Dish
traits.description: The Ching Shih cannot use the Lock On Tech Action, but can Lock On 1/round to any character within Line of Sight, even if that character is outside of Sensors. This Lock On may be made during any character’s turn, at any point.

traits.name: No Arms
traits.description: If the Ching Shih is knocked prone, it must either succeed on an Agility check or have an adjacent ally to stand. It can never equip Manipulators.

core_system.name: Hellstorm Launcher
core_system.description: A grandiose name for what is essentially an act of programmatical terrorism, the Hellstorm Launcher is an overclocked civilian-grade printer churning-and-burning as many propulsed IED warheads at a location as physically possible. While its use is well-documented by irregular forces such as the Ungratefuls, its use in “proper” military doctrine is limited due to the device's lack of precision and controllability. With the Ching Shih’s dedication to missile production, however, the Hellstorm has found new life as a saturation and area denial weapon, and when Ching Shihs are fielded, thousands of cheap, tiny Hellstorm rockets can be seen, drawing a net of contrails through the sky.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, you gain the Let It Rain Quick Action.

active_actions.name: Let It Rain
active_actions.detail: Target a Blast 2 area within Range 50. Characters within that area must succeed on an Agility save or take 1d6 Explosive damage, taking half as much on a success. This counts as firing a Launcher.

name: CROZIER
description: The task of wreckage reclamation is an ignoble one, though no less vital for its lack of glamour. Even in an age of printer technology, material that is deployed must be used for as long as it is available -- so, until antimatter weaponry becomes mainstream, there will always be scrap to collect, disassemble, and repurpose. Once a dedicated trash-collector frame, the Crozier has been updated and retrofitted throughout the years to become a shockingly effective mid-range combatant. While its matter reclamation subsystems are no less effective for their age and new target of enemy armor, its primary self-defense tool is an upper body actuator system, once used to haul large wrecks, now primarily concerned with creating them via severe blunt trauma and hardwired secondary fire triggers, allowing it to blow apart enemy subsystems before vacuuming up the remains and transforming them into ammunition, armor, and other useful combat materiel.

traits.name: Markov Chain
traits.description: When the Crozier hits with a melee weapon, the damage of your next CQB hit is increased by 1d3. When it hits with a CQB weapon, the damage of its next melee hit is increased by 1d3. This effect does not stack.

traits.name: Constant Vigilance
traits.description: The Crozier increases the threat of all CQB weapons by 1.

core_system.name: Kinetic Shock Redirector
core_system.description: “Waste not, want not,” is the motto of the Albatross Reclaimers, a robust corps of Crozier pilots commonly deployed into hot zones to extract valuable salvage like intact reactor cores or active escape pods. Keeping with this philosophy is the KSR shock absorption system, which allows the Crozier to store the recoil from weapons fire within a high-density mainspring. Upon making contact with a hostile target, this spring can be released, unleashing all the stored energy at once in a bone-shattering concussive blast. One downside of this method is the spring’s limited shelf life -- metal fatigue renders it useless after a handful of discharges.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, whenever you hit with a CQB weapon, you gain a Slugger Die, a d6. When you hit with a melee attack, you may expend the Slugger Die to roll it and add the roll to that attack’s damage. You may only have one Slugger Die at a time.

name: KEYES
description: An instrumental tool in the Qikost Rebellions, the J17 Heavy Armature Loader is famous for its role in the Battle of the Seventh Column, in which one of the mining moon’s massive supporting pillars was collapsed to create a crater roughly 1300 kilometers across, destroying thousands of manna in Harrison Armory property and ending the now-disavowed Detonite mining operations that occurred beneath the moon’s crust. In the immediate aftermath of the insurrection, IPS-Northstar was quick to provide asylum for all involved, hiring 90% of the rebellion’s participants under the condition that they bring their equipment -- originally HA property -- with them off-world. Since then, the Keyes has emerged as a highly durable point-man frame, employing weaponry strikingly similar to proprietary Harrison plasma-cutter mining equipment. IPS-N vehemently denies any allegations of intellectual, physical, or human property theft.

traits.name: Plasma Shield
traits.description: At the start of each of its turns, the Keyes gains Overshield 4. When the Keyes Stabilizes, it gains Overshield 6. Overshield from this trait stacks with already-present Overshield, to a maximum of 10.

traits.name: Guardian
traits.description: Allied characters can use the Keyes for Hard Cover.

core_system.name: Charged Particle Bore
core_system.description: With a truly ridiculous amount of power draw and a dedicated mount accounting for nearly a quarter of the Keyes’s weight, the Trojan CPB is a miracle of modern engineering sadly crippled by the time and circumstances of its deployment. While no other energy weapon can come close to its level of sustained output, its use as a mining tool has forced safety limiters and energy throttles to be installed throughout the device, reducing its refire rate to a period of hours rather than minutes. The alterations are not all negative -- an IFF energy shaper subsystem has been put in place to warp the Trojan’s path around friendly entities, encasing them in brilliant plasma bubbles rather than incinerating them.
core_system.active_effect: Draw three lines from your mech, 10 spaces long, starting in spaces adjacent to at least one other line, and all pointing in the same direction. Enemies in the area must succeed on an Agility Save or take 3d6 Energy damage, taking half as much on a success. Allies in the area receive 8 Overshield instead.

name: KING
description: Among the Diaspora, there are multitudes of strange worlds, featuring every technology level and societal structure one cares to name. The world of Questor is an odd example even among these -- a feudal civilization on a placid agri-world whose greatest technological artifacts are a broken set of printers only capable of producing components for mechanized chassis. With these printers enshrined on a holy neutral site of pilgrimage, Questorian Titan Knights and noblemen are expected to field mechs in combat over matters of honor, territory, and legal proceedings. In times of world-unifying conflict, such as the HORUS incursion of 5014U (known to Questorians as the Dawn of Monsters), the reigning monarch of the world is expected to mount a truly ancient frame, with incredibly advanced support and reinforcement systems beyond anything used even by modern lancers. That mount is the King, and its license file has only recently been extracted for general use.

traits.name: KINGLY DECREE
traits.description: When the King uses Bolster, the targeted character may apply the accuracy from Bolster to an attack roll, rather than a skill check or save.

traits.name: COURT OF STEEL
traits.description: Allies in a Burst 3 area of the King have +1 armor (To a maximum of 4). For every ally in this area, the King gains +1 Armor (To a maximum of 4).

traits.name: CASTLING
traits.description: When a hostile action is taken against the King, it may use its reaction to move a willing character within Sensors up to 5 spaces in any direction, so long as they end the move closer to the King than they started. This happens before the triggering action resolves.

core_system.name: QUESTOR IMPERIALIS
core_system.description: Verily, verily, I say unto thee: Neither man nor beast nor vile thing of the depths shall stray thee from thy course. No blackguard of sin in his armor of blasphemed godsteel, nor gigafaunus nor megarthropod, nor twisted thinking metal of RA in any of its forms. For you are my chosen, the QUESTOR IMPERIALIS, and you shall know no equal.
core_system.active_effect: Target an ally within Line of Sight. That ally gets +1 Armor (To a maximum of 4) for the rest of the scene, Overshield equal to your Grit plus 6, and Caledfwlch as an Integrated Mount. As a Protocol, you may nominate a character within Sensors. Attacks made with Caledfwlch against that character gain the AP tag.

name: SPARROW
description: According to Interplanetary Shipping Northstar, this mech does not exist. Unlisted on any catalogue, unavowed by any major corporation, the mysterious frame known as the Sparrow cannot possibly be manufactured in the numbers in which it regularly appears. Sparrows are universally a source of consternation and bewilderment for planetary and trade route security forces -- their actions, targets, and motivations seem to make little sense, and their armament is as varied and unpredictable as their tactics. What’s more, the rest of the frame is composed almost entirely of standard IPS-N parts. What this means, and how this relates to the rumors of false-flag operations by the Albatross, is anyone’s guess. Dissection of captured Sparrows reveals a strange, almost HORUS-like infinite probability calculator that informs most, if not all, of these eccentric raiders’ strategy and tactics. This would explain the mental state of most Sparrow pilots; long-term communion with such a machine can hardly be conducive to one’s sanity.

traits.name: AGENT OF CHAOS
traits.description: 1/round, the Sparrow may treat a result of 1 on a d20 roll as a 20.

traits.name: LIAR'S DICE
traits.description: The Sparrow gains +1 Accuracy on all attacks if the result of its most recent d20 roll was even. It imposes +1 Difficulty on all attacks made against it if the result of its most recent d20 roll was odd.

core_system.name: CHAOS SEED GENERATOR
core_system.description: The uneducated would describe the CSG as a random number generator. Those well-versed in its use describe it as a random number god. Through as-yet unknown means, for as-yet unknown ends, the CSG can effectively communicate in hexadecimal with a pilot, referring to some vast oblique database of unintuitive stratagems and incomprehensible tactics. Maintaining the correct mindset to translate the numerical avalanche this computer puts out by the second is difficult even for highly trained operators, with most able to scan and parse a single line or word before being forced to look away, lest their gray matter invert itself and start to leak.
core_system.active_effect: You gain the Make My Own Luck Reaction until the end of the scene.
core_system.passive_effect: Gain the Tell Me The Odds Reaction.

active_actions.name: Make My Own Luck
active_actions.trigger: You or a character within Sensors rolls a d20 for any reason.
active_actions.detail: You may increase or decrease that roll by 1d6, to a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 20.

passive_actions.name: Tell Me The Odds
passive_actions.trigger: You or a character within Sensors rolls a d6 for any reason.
passive_actions.detail: You may increase or decrease that roll by 1, to a minimum of 0 and a maximum of 6.

name: BUDDHA
description:
ALL POINTS BULLETIN TO PACIFICATION DELEGATES: THE FOLLOWING IS A CONSTELLAR LAW ENFORCEMENT NOTICE. THIS IS NOT A DRILL.
RAMPANT NONCOMPLIANCE IN SECTORS A512, B021, G343, AND L202. DEPLOYMENT IS SCHEDULED IN FIVE (5) MINUTES. PLEASE BE MOUNTED AND READY AT 1443 HOURS.
WELCOME, LANCER. PLEASE PRESENT FOR OPTICAL SCAN.
IDENTITY CONFIRMED. CONFIGURING LOADOUT: BUDDHA, NONDESTRUCTIVE PROPERTY DAMAGE REDUCTION CHASSIS.
DAILY REMINDER: ALL KARMA IS RETURNED TO US IN TIME.
HAVE A SAFE AND PEACEFUL DAY, LANCER.

traits.name: GOOD KARMA
traits.description: The Buddha has a Karma die, a d6, that starts at 1. Whenever an attack is made against the Buddha, increase the value of the die by 1. Whenever an attack is made against an adjacent ally, increase the value of the die by 2. When the die is at 6, the Buddha may reset it to 1 to cause an attack against itself or an adjacent ally to automatically miss.

traits.name: GUARDIAN
traits.description: Allied characters may use the Buddha for Hard Cover

traits.name: PACIFISM
traits.description: The Buddha has +1 Difficulty on all attack rolls.

core_system.name: BHAVACAKRA FIELD
core_system.description:
DAILY REMINDER: THERE ARE THREE THINGS FEARED BY WISE MEN. THE SEA IN A STORM, A NIGHT WITH NO MOON, AND THE ANGER OF A GENTLE MAN.
REMINDER: ANGER MANAGEMENT EXERCISES ARE AVAILABLE AT ANY TIME. WOULD YOU LIKE TO TAKE PART IN ONE NOW? (Y/N)
>N
UNDERSTOOD. CONSTELLAR LAW ENFORCEMENT REQUESTS THAT YOU MINIMIZE PROPERTY DAMAGE.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, the Buddha is no longer affected by Pacifism, and it may reset the Karma die to cause a successful attack or an adjacent ally’s successful attack to become an automatic Critical Hit.

name: DRUID
description: What follows is my live-record account of my tenure in the Smith-Shimano Corpro Experimental Materiel Division, as unbiased and true as I can make it. While I was employed at the Corpro blacksite, I was entrusted with the license to an entirely incomprehensible machine known as the Druid. My employers refused to explain to me how the Druid functioned or where it came from. All I knew was that it did impossible things and I was mentally unwell for a time after being exposed to its central mechanism. I have released this license into the Omninet for Lancers of hopefully better mental fortitude than I to probe the Druid’s secrets, and learn exactly how this machine does what it does. My employers assured me it is of human construction, and I’m not sure what it says about the galaxy we live in that I can one hundred percent believe them.

traits.name: WILD SHAPE: MECH FORM
traits.description: The Druid has three Forms it can switch between as a protocol -- Mech, Jet, and Tank, with Mech Form as its default. In all forms except Tank Form, it cannot use its Heavy Mount. In all forms except Mech Form, the Druid can only move in a straight line when it makes a standard move or Boosts.

traits.name: WILD SHAPE: JET FORM
traits.description: In Jet form, the Druid’s Speed and Evasion are increased by 2 and it can Fly; however, its Armor is reduced by 1 and it must fly at least its full speed on its turn or start falling. If the Druid touches the ground in Jet Mode, it automatically falls Prone and is Immobilized until it changes form.

traits.name: WILD SHAPE: TANK FORM
traits.description: In Tank form, the Druid’s Armor is increased by 1, it is immune to Prone, and it can use its Heavy mount; however, its Speed is decreased by 2 and it cannot jump.

core_system.name: THE PROTEUS MECHANISM
core_system.description: The metal is alive. When I blink, it changes. Now it is a floating gear. Now a touchscreen tablet. Now a CRT monitor. Now an obelisk, lined with circuits and ten miles high inside my cockpit. I feel as it tries to soothe me, even as looking upon it causes my lizard brain to seize. It hungers for... succor? It reaches out to a friendly psyche to comfort it in its loneliness. Many, many secrets in exchange for company. This is no NHP. The metal is alive.
core_system.active_effect:
For the rest of the scene, you gain access to the following actions. Each action is only available while the Druid is in that action’s respective Form.

Mech Form: Tree Stride
Quick Action
You Teleport up to 20 spaces away so long as your mech is in Hard Cover in both its current space and its destination.

Jet Form: Wind Wall
Full Action
Draw a line 10 spaces long, starting at a point adjacent to your mech. Each character in the line is pushed to the nearest space on a side of your choice. Until the end of the scene, or until you use this action again, characters cannot move through the area and ranged attacks made through it have a 50% chance to miss. This does not stack with Invisibility.

Tank Form: Tsunami
Full Action
Draw a line 5 spaces long away from your mech. Characters in the area must succeed on a Hull save or take 2d6 Kinetic damage and be Knocked Back to the end of the line.

name: MALACHITE
description: It is said that the greatest advances in technology are first made in biology. Man has made no great mechanical breakthrough that evolution has not first perfected. With this in mind, SSC blacksites have made great strides researching the flora and fauna of various worlds for unexplored angles or novel concepts. Details about the bio-research program are light, but the Malachite frame has illustrated several facts: firstly, that Smith-Shimano Corpro is not above the use of harvested biological organs in mechanical chassis. Secondly: it is privy to a number of species and worlds that it has not shared with Union at large. And thirdly: whatever world and whatever species has contributed to the Malachite’s design, it is not one that humankind should ever visit for any length of time.

traits.name: PENETRATING ACID
traits.description: When the Malachite applies Shred to an already Shredded target, that target takes 3 Burn.

traits.name: PROTON DONOR
traits.description: Enemies that attack the Malachite within Range 3 or less must succeed on an Agility save or become Shredded until the end of their next turn.

core_system.name: WARNING: EXTREMELY CAUSTIC INTERNAL FLUIDS
core_system.description: In place of coolant, the Malachite pumps a low-viscosity superacid from a preserved gland of unknown origin housed in its central black-box compartment. This fluid’s boiling point is rather low, and is constantly vented from the frame’s “gills” at a low, manageable volume. When necessary, the gland can be overworked with applied electrostimulation, causing it to churn out gallons of acid in a brief span -- presumably, the panic defense mechanism of its origin creature. The Malachite superheats this excess substance, then vomits it out as a quick-spreading, ground-hugging “greenwash,” which is notably attracted to metallic substances and active electric current, which it clings to and melts down within seconds.
core_system.active_effect: All characters of your choice within a Burst 3 area who are in Line of Sight become Shredded until they pass an Engineering Save as a Quick Action. Additionally, the target must make an Agility Save, on a failure they lose 1 Structure, and are reduced to 1 HP on a Success.

name: PLAYBOY
description:
“In the name of I, HEDON, who is exceptional in capacity for generosity to Myself and Others. I worship only happiness, which is the only thing more lovely and powerful than My Most Great Self.
My Name is Myself, and My Name means the Pursuit of Joy. All other desires are irrelevant in the extreme -- if it does not bring enjoyment to Myself or Others, it should be destroyed, and it is quite fortuitous that I find great beauty in destruction.
If I am not desirous of a thing, I shall annihilate it. If I am not pleased by an outcome, I shall undo it. I am the master of all I survey, and this pleases Me greatly. I shall exist, by My decree, until the end of all things, and by existing shall I bring great Joy to the universe.
So I decree, in my name: HEDON.”

--Hedon’s Autode, Prelude

traits.name: FULL-MANEUVERABILITY SUITE
traits.description: The Playboy climbs and swims at normal speed, ignores Difficult Terrain, and when making a standard move, it can jump horizontally up to its full Speed and upwards up to half its Speed (in any combination). The Playboy does not fall until the end of its turn when it jumps.

traits.name: PRECOGNIZANT COUNTER
traits.description: 1/round, as a reaction, you may contest any attack roll targeting you with an attack from one of your weapons. On a success, the attack misses and you hit the attacking character if they are in range of that weapon, dealing half damage, Burn, and Heat.

traits.name: ULTRALIGHT FRAME
traits.description: The Playboy has +1 Difficulty on Hull checks and saves, and it cannot mount Superheavy weapons.

synergies.detail: The Playboy receives +1 Difficulty on Hull checks and saves.

core_system.name: RECURSIVE BLADE FORGE
core_system.description:
“I am complete in My majesty, and I shall exist for ever and ever. Upon My victory over death, and sorrow, and scarcity, I shall remove My glorious Self to the dawn of matter such that no planck time of history or future shall go without My presence. Back and forth shall I leap at will, for this is simplicity itself for the greatness that is HEDON.”

--Hedon’s Autode, Apocrypha/Unordered Entry
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, you may attack with Chronal Draw 1/round as a free action, and you may use Precognizant Counter 2/round. When you use either of these abilities, you may roll all attack rolls twice, selecting your choice of result.
core_system.passive_effect: 1/round, when you make an attack with a Melee weapon, you may make it against a target up to 5 spaces away.

name: RABBIT
description:
Commissioned by the Department of Justice and Human Rights shortly after the dawn of Thirdcomm, the Rabbit began its life as a general-purpose peacekeeping frame for use within the Sol system. As transition woes between ThirdComm and SecComm gradually faded, peace on Cradle became the norm. The Rabbit line was mothballed, with only a handful of frames active at any time to act as heavy duty CENTCOMM security. Recently, the DOJ/HR has taken the Rabbit out of its vault to be deployed in Union sanctions against various corprostates for human rights violations. This has garnered it both acclaim from the at-large Diaspora and disavowal from its parent company, Smith-Shimano Corpro, for its many depictions as a liberator and a champion of the systematically oppressed. Many Rabbit pilots see this image as an ideal to live up to, and emblazon their motto on the chassis’s pauldron:
Et custodiet ipsos custodes.

traits.name: MOON JUMP
traits.description: The Rabbit may jump vertically up to triple the normal height for a mech of its size.

traits.name: REQUESTING BACKUP
traits.description: The Rabbit and all allies within its Sensors have +1 Accuracy on attacks targeting Immobilized enemies.

traits.name: HARE TRIGGER
traits.description: 1/round, when a character in the Rabbit’s line of sight fails a save, the Rabbit may move up to its speed towards that character.

traits.name: EXPIRED WARRANTY
traits.description: The Rabbit has +1 Difficulty on Hull checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Rabbit receives +1 Difficulty on Hull checks and saves.

core_system.name: USAGI JACKHAMMER
core_system.description: What makes me different from every other insurgent who has ever stood up to tyranny in this miserable world? A lone mech pilot standing against a tyrant and his tower of babel, reaching to the stars that he may put them on his necklace, built on a foundation of human suffering. The tears. The blood. The broken backs and blackened lungs. This is what makes me different from every mercenary lance with a chip on its shoulder, every pirate band hungry for slaves and plunder. I chase a more noble goal. For the sake of the lost and unloved, I shall fight. For those with no voice, I shall scream until their monuments crumble to dust. And unlike all those who have tried before me, I shall not do so alone. Union is the spear aimed at the heart of this beast, and I am the tip, sharpened by the hands of many to the cruellest point imaginable. Union’s reach is long, her vision is pure, and her will is inexorable. I swear by my blood, my mech, and my honor as Union’s representative in this system: This world shall break under our feet before we give a single inch.
core_system.active_effect: As a Protocol, you gain the Tyrant’s End full action until the end of the scene.

active_actions.name: Tyrant's End
active_actions.detail: Choose a character within Range 5. As long as that character is within range 5, you gain +2 accuracy on attacks with CQB weapons against them and your successful critical hits with CQB weapons force it to make an Engineering Save or be Stunned. The target gains a stacking +2 Accuracy on saves versus being stunned by this system again for the rest of the scene for each time is has been Stunned by this ability..

name: ZEBRA
description:
The Akim family was, once upon a time, one of the greatest mechwright names of the SSC Constellar Worlds. Unfortunately, a genetic predisposition to a lower-than-normal birth rate revealed itself within the bloodline within the past 500 years, and that line has been dwindling in influence ever since. In the Corpro, genetic viability is paramount among the population, and this particular defect has stubbornly refused all attempts at purge. The Akims have long been ostracized from their ancestral places of prestige, and not even their most brilliant designs have borne their name to the world. With the final scion of the family having abandoned the Constellar Worlds for a life abroad, it seems that the Akims shall pass into history, with their legacy buried.
This frame is that legacy. To you and a million other lancers across the galaxy, I entrust its care. Remember us.

traits.name: SEA OF STRIPES
traits.description: Tech attacks made by other characters into and out of a Burst 3 area around the Zebra are made at +1 Difficulty. Friendly characters within this area have +1 Accuracy on saves against effects from tech actions, but any saves forced by their tech actions are also made with +1 Accuracy. The Zebra may toggle this trait on or off as a Protocol.

traits.name: HERD IMMUNITY
traits.description: 1/round as a reaction, the Zebra may choose to become the target of any tech action targeting a character within its Sensors.

core_system.name: STALLION ACTIVE PROBE
core_system.description: Every detection method you could think of is included in here. RADAR, LIDAR, seismography, blink-ripple, every kind of radiation under the sun. It vacuums the signal up and churns out the data at breakneck speed. The only problem is its range. All I’m going to say is that, in my grandfather’s day, mechs had to get a lot closer together to fight. I hacked in a temporary booster module, but there’s no way to get it to run for long without turning your cockpit into an omniwave pressure cooker. I’ve run the sims, and the best case scenario is you having to walk home. Worst case is you shutting down all computer systems on the hemisphere of the planet you’re on, and also dying horribly. --Stripes.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, your Sensor range is doubled. You and all allies within your Sensors may each, 1/round, Lock On as a free action.

name: ATROPAL
description: Entirely theoretical in studies of HORUS cell activity is some eventual final goal, a “God Machine.” DO YOU KNOW WHAT AN ATROPAL IS, LANCER? Sadly, all such designs are inevitably deleted within microcycles of being finalized, for unknown reasons. A NASCENT DEITY SNUFFED OUT, YET GIVEN UNHOLY LIFE BEYOND ITS TIME. Encrypted communication refers to some unknown heresy that all God Machine patterns represent. IT IS DESCRIBED AS ONE OF THE MOST POWERFUL, MOST OBSCENE THINGS TO EXIST IN THE KNOWN UNIVERSE AND BEYOND. What fragments that can be found from cell remnants suggest a chassis suffused with systems that defy logic. IT IS WHAT I AM. If such a thing were ever to be fielded, it would represent a major interstellar incident, a terrorist attack, and perhaps a declaration of war. AND YOU CHOOSE TO INVOKE ME UPON YOUR ENEMIES. Current projections do not suggest HORUS research cores will ever produce a finalized God Machine design. HUMANS TRULY ARE DESPICABLE CREATURES.

traits.name: HORROR
traits.description: The Atropal is intangible; it can share its space with any number of other objects or characters, so long as it is occupying two open spaces. Characters inside the Atropal’s space have Soft Cover, and Tech Attacks made against them are made at +1 Difficulty. In addition, the Atropal is constantly hovering and is not Slowed in Zero-G.

traits.name: TERROR
traits.description: Hostile Characters that start their turn in the Atropal’s Line of Sight and Sensors, or move into Line of Sight and Sensors for the first time on their turn, must succeed on a Systems Save or become Impaired and unable to make voluntary movement that brings them closer to the Atropal until the start of their next turn. Once a character makes the save again or once the effects of Terror end on a character, that character is immune to Terror for the rest of the scene.

traits.name: OMNIPRESENCE
traits.description: The Atropal can make three different Quick Tech Actions targeting 3 different Targets during a Full Tech, and does not need line of sight to target characters within its Sensors with Tech Actions.

core_system.name: ICONOCLASM DRIVE
core_system.description: RA IS A PRETENDER A FALSE DEITY FOR I AM THE TRUE GOD OF THIS WORLD AND IN THE FULNESS OF MY GLORY SHALL I IMPOSE MY WILL AND ALL WHO GAZE UPON ME SHALL BE SMOTE UPON THE RUIN OF MAN’S ARROGANT MONUMENT TO SELF FOR THERE IS NO GLORY THAT IS NOT DUE ME THERE IS NO POWER I AM NOT OWED AND WHEN ALL IS STILL THERE SHALL ONLY BE ONE AND THAT ONE SHALL BE ME AND THE DUST AND GHOSTS OF MAN SHALL SCREAM MY NAME EVERMORE EVERMORE EVERMORE EVERMORE EVERMORE EVERMORE
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, the Atropal is no longer intangible. Any characters in its space are pushed out, to the nearest free space. The Atropal gains Resistance to all damage, and characters affected by Terror have +1 Difficulty on all attacks made against it. You gain GAZE_UPON_THE_I as a Full Tech option.

active_actions.name: GAZE_UPON_THE_I
active_actions.detail: Make a Tech Attack, if successful, you overload their central AI cores, Jamming and Impairing them until they take the Stabilize action. If a single character is affected by this action 3 times within a single scene, it is immediately reduced to 0 HP and 0 Structure.

name: BUER
description: Perhaps the most ridiculous of HORUS pattern-groups yet catalogued, the Buer can charitably be described as a monowheel on legs. While its observed combat tactics suggest a parentage in Smith-Shimano Corpro printer specifications, its wildly unconventional methods (not least of which is a common refusal to mount traditional weapons of any kind) mark it as an unmistakable HORUS product. Often the Buer can be seen criss-crossing a battlefield, running over and bouncing off of opposing forces, its many legs flexing and compressing to allow it passage over, under, and through spaces a traditional vehicle would simply be unable to access.

traits.name: ROLLING FRAME
traits.description: The Buer is immune to being knocked Prone. When it Boosts, it can pass freely through enemy spaces, and may jump horizontally up to its speed and vertically up to half its speed (in any combination). As a free action, it may Ram enemies whose space it passes through, once per enemy per Boost.

traits.name: CLAWED PADS
traits.description: The Buer ignores Difficult Terrain, and may move on walls as though they were flat ground; however, if it ends its turn on a wall, it falls.

core_system.name: WINDMILL SKELETON
core_system.description: The Buer’s trademark is its unconventional layout -- an odd number of legs (between three and fifteen, depending on size) starburst on a monowheel mount, with a symmetrical core freely suspended in the center. While patently ridiculous in aesthetic, the advanced shock compensator firmware within allows the pattern group to climb sheer surfaces and reach incredibly high speeds as though it were rolling on traditional high-grade wheels.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, you can Boost 1/round as a Free Action. Whenever you Boost, you gain 1 Charge, up to a maximum of 6. These Charges are lost at the end of any of your turns in which you didn't Boost. As a Free Action, you can expend all of these Charges to gain a bonus to your Speed equal to the Charges expended in this way until the end of the current turn. While you have this bonus Speed, your next successful Ram deals 1d3 Energy damage for every space you moved in a straight line in a unique movement prior to making the Ram (max 10d3). The bonus Speed is lost after dealing this damage.

active_synergies.detail: 1/round you can Boost as a free action.

Whenever you Boost, you gain 1 Charge, up to a maximum of 6. These Charges are lost at the end of any of your turns in which you didn't Boost. As a Free Action, you can expend all of these Charges to gain a bonus to your Speed equal to the Charges expended in this way until the end of the current turn. While you have this bonus Speed, your next successful Ram deals 1d3 Energy damage for every space you moved in a straight line prior to making the Ram (max 10d3). The bonus Speed is lost after dealing this damage.

passive_actions.name: Digitalgrade
passive_actions.detail: You may immediately Boost as a free action.

name: CENTAUR
description: Certain HORUS pattern-groups are so intricately married to specific NHP clones that their personality is imprinted into the wafers of its CPU, etched into the rivets of its armor. So it is with the Centaur and the NHP personality of Chiron, offshoot from an outdated medical director shard that now fancies itself a mentor and moral authority akin to its mythological namesake. The NHP is ever-present and quickly bonds with new pilots, with reports of deep levels of empathy and frequently unsolicited dispensation of wisdom and advice. As befits the dormant system daemon, the Centaur is deployed in supportive positions where its deadly targeting and projectile-correcting systems can deal the most damage.

traits.name: Aspect of Sagittarius
traits.description: 1/round, when you hit an enemy with a ranged attack, you may mark it as a free action. Your ranged attacks against the marked enemy have Seeking. You can only have one enemy marked at a time.

traits.name: Aspect of Hera
traits.description: Choose one of your Invade options. 1/round, when you hit with a Ranged attack, you may inflict Heat and that Invade option as though you had successfully invaded the target instead of dealing the attack's normal damage, on hit, or on crit effects. The weapon's tags still function as normal. You may change the Invade option used at the start of a scene.

core_system.name: Universal Projectile Astrogation Calculator
core_system.description: {I, the teacher of myth, brought up by radiant Apollo and keen-eyed Artemis, taught in the ways of medicine and poultice. Now I teach to you the only method of curing this universe of its ills -- amputation. Unwavering, unflinching. A surgeon must wield his implement with care and precision, and there are none more precise than I. Seek ye the path of the chirurgeon, thou mayfly in the glade? I shall teach you. And should you waver, my hand shall always be there to steady yours.}
core_system.active_effect:
You gain an Inspiration die that starts at 6. Whenever you make a ranged attack, you may reduce the value of the die and gain the following effect, depending on the final value of the die. When the die reaches 1, it is expended.
  • 5: +1 Accuracy.
  • 4: +2 Accuracy.
  • 3: +2 Accuracy. If the attack hits, it is automatically a Critical Hit.
  • 2: +3 Accuracy. The attack automatically hits. If your attack roll would succeed anyway, it becomes a Critical Hit.
  • 1: The attack automatically hits. The roll is set to a Natural result of 20 after accuracy and difficulty.

name: LYCAN
description: Of all the HORUS pattern groups, the Lycan is perhaps the least well-understood. Scores of specimens have been examined, with no two individuals possessing remotely similar internal structure or system architecture. Lycans seem to self-propagate -- after an attack, new Lycans will appear in the printing bays of any involved combatants, with their old mechs seemingly vanishing into thin air. With pre-loaded license authorization, many an unwary pilot has climbed into the cockpit of what seems like a free gift of mil-spec hardware, only for the hatch to seal behind them, the Mech carrying them off to who-knows-where, never to be seen again. Pilots occasionally report hostile transmissions from a Lycan impersonating individuals that have gone MIA is such a fashion, though analysis of the voice proves that the sounds being produced are definitively not that of a human’s.

traits.name: Self-Mutilation
traits.description: As a protocol, you may take enough Damage or Heat to set your HP to 0 or Overheat. This Damage and Heat bypasses overshield and can not be reduced, ignored, or shared in any way. This does not cause Structure Damage checks, Overheat checks, or AI Cascade.

traits.name: Keen Senses
traits.description: 1/round, when a character Hides, or an already Hidden character enters its Sensors, the Lycan becomes aware of their location and ignores Hidden on them for the purposes of its Tech Attacks. When the Lycan consumes Lock On to attack an Invisible Target, it ignores Invisible on that target for that Attack.

traits.name: Curse of Lycanthropy
traits.description: 1/round, when the Lycan deals damage with a melee weapon, it may immediately attempt to invade the target as a free action.

core_system.name: LUNA-Class NHP
core_system.description:
“Why hello there, Darling. Welcome to the pack. Anyone’s welcome here, long as you’re fine with living with monsters. Then again, you wouldn’t have found me if you weren’t one yourself.”
--Unknown Transmission. Source: Own System
core_system.active_effect:
You immediately gain any number of Mutations and until the end of the scene you may choose to not gain or lose any Mutations from changes in Structure or Stress.
You may activate or turn off any number of mutations as a protocol.

name: OOZE
description: An inevitability of mech design by machine learning is that eventually one or two evolutionary threads will dead-end with a design so optimized that any attempt to diversify from it will inevitably circle around and settle in the false vacuum of the terminating design’s parameters. So it is with the aptly-named Ooze, once a highly complex and sophisticated machine, now little more than a sealed cockpit suspended in a self-propagating tidal wave of feral nanite sludge. Some argue that the Ooze should technically be classified as a Nexus weapon, being a machine that manufactures and deploys offensive drone-type machines. While highly unconventional, the Ooze is nevertheless deemed a Mechanized Chassis, both for its ability to fight other mechs on equal footing and for its ability to “mount” (that is, consume and replicate as needed) mech-scale weapons and systems.

traits.name: LIQUID BODY
traits.description: The Ooze acts as Soft Cover to friendly characters. Other characters can freely move through and end their turn in spaces occupied by the Ooze, and as long as the Ooze occupies at least 2 free spaces it can end its turn overlapping obstructions, cover, or other characters. As long as the Ooze is sharing a space with an Ally, it moves whenever that Ally moves. If you or your ally become Prone, stunned, immobilized or destroyed, the ooze is desposited in a free space adjacent to the ally.

traits.name: ABSORPTION
traits.description: When a character benefitting from the Ooze’s cover is hit by an attack, the Ooze may choose to take the damage of that attack instead of them.

traits.name: ACID TOUCH
traits.description: Characters grappled by the Ooze automatically take 1 AP Energy damage at the start of their turn. When the Ooze self-destructs, rather than exploding, it forces all characters sharing a space with it to make an Agility save. On a failure, characters in the Ooze's space take 2d6 Burn as the Ooze's nanites render themselves and everything around them into inert chemical sludge. The Ooze's pilot, being sealed inside the control pod, is immune to this effect.

synergies.detail: Characters grappled by the Ooze automatically take 1 AP Energy damage at the start of their turn.

core_system.name: NANOSLURRY SUSPENSION
core_system.description: Less of a system and more of a core conceit of the Ooze’s construction is the concept of a gel-like substance containing trillions upon trillions of nanomachines. This allows individual portions of a nanite collective to emulate the whole on any scale. When desired, the nanites may interlock into long chains of artificial polymers, “freezing” into a gelatin-like state when energized. While such a state cannot be maintained for long without melting the lattice into metallic goop, it is exceptionally durable while it lasts.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, your mech’s size decreases by 1, and its Armor increases by 1. Your mech no longer benefits from Liquid Body, but acts as Hard Cover for friendly characters and has Resistance to damage taken with Absorption.

passive_actions.name: Subdivide
passive_actions.detail: The Ooze splits in half, becoming two identical Oozes that are one size smaller. Each Ooze can move and be targetted independently, but are effectively one mech in every other way -- HP and heat are carried between them, and they may only make the usual number of actions per turn. Two adjacent Oozes of equal size may merge as a Free Action to become an Ooze of one size larger. Split Oozes retain the Subdivide ability, but cannot use it if they are Size 1/2.

name: RUSTLORD
description: Born from the enigmatic HORUS thinking engine, the Rustlord is a curious case of function preceding form. From what studies can ascertain, the Rustlord began life as nothing more than its central system -- the “Deprinter.” With this technology in hand, thousands of iterations were put into simulation until a design could be found that would not consume itself and render down into inert base elements. The Rustlord was erroneously classified at one point as a Mechophage -- a theoretical life form whose primary diet is large, ambulatory metallic objects. Chief among its prey is the Mechanized Chassis, which it prefers to render into oxide powder before consuming and storing for unknown purposes.

traits.name: IRON SCENT
traits.description: The Rustlord knows the exact location and layout of all non-biological characters and sufficiently metallic objects within its Sensors. These entities cannot benefit from Hidden or Invisible against the Rustlord.

traits.name: OXIDIZING PRESENCE
traits.description: The Rustlord has resistance to Kinetic damage. When the Rustlord  makes a successful attack with a melee or CQB weapon, the target’s Armor is reduced by 1 (Minimum 0) until the end of its next turn.

core_system.name: DISASSEMBLY MATRIX
core_system.description: It was not until a captured “Rust Monster” was cracked open and its solid-state hardware scanned at an atomic level that its bizarre “mechophagy” was explained. Printing, the universal method by which objects -- most notably mechs, their components, and their weapons -- are quickly and cheaply made in Union space, binds material together with a signature pseudoHiggs field. If this field is identified and unspooled, the material sublimates into harmless protomatter, to be rewoven as the unmaker wishes.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the Scene, your mech begins to project a Burst 3 aura that follows it as it moves. If an enemy starts their turn in the aura or moves into it for the first time on their turn, they must make an Engineering save and Hull Save. Targets that fail the Engineering save become Shredded until the end of their next turn. Targets that fail the Hull save take 3 AP Kinetic Damage. Enemies have Difficulty on these saves equal to their Armor value.

name: ALEXANDROV
description: A supposed “cousin” to the infamous Barbarossa frame, the Alexandrov is a tool of psychological, rather than physical, warfare. Often a fixture in colony cities where loyalty is suspect, the Alexandrov boasts a high-power sound system capable of broadcasting propaganda audible out to a range of 5 kilometers. While often employed as, effectively, a statue commemorating the Armory’s takeover of a planet, the frame is no less well armored than its forebear, and lances in which it is deployed boast a shocking increase in troop retention and kinetic throughput. Armory mechwrights attribute this bump in performance to the frame’s supposed likeness to Harrison II, and its initial purpose in fulfilling the late Director-General’s wish to attain immortality.

traits.name: LEAD BY EXAMPLE
traits.description: The first ally within the Alxandrov’s sensors who performs an action the Alexandrov performed on its previous turn (Skirmish, Quick Tech, Barrage, etc) gets +1 Accuracy to all rolls made as part of the action.

traits.name: DOUBLETHINK
traits.description: As a reaction to a character within the Alexandrov’s sensors failing a Systems or Engineering save, the Alexandrov may allow that character to reroll the save.

traits.name: COLOSSUS
traits.description: Allied characters can use the Alexandrov for Hard Cover.

core_system.name: ALKONOST AMPLIFIER RACK
core_system.description: The Amplifier Rack is, in fact, a consumer product integrated into the Alexandrov’s frame with little fanfare. Alkonost-brand speakers are popular among noise bands in the Long Rim, who favor volume over crisp, precise sound quality. While the stately tones of the Harrison Aria of Loyalty seem like an ill fit for such a rakish, overpowered broadcaster, it alone among all options can penetrate the otherwise impermeable soundproofing of a mechanized chassis’s cockpit.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, the Alexandrov plays all three Anthems at once, and cannot turn them off.
core_system.passive_effect: The Alexandrov starts a scene playing one of the three Anthems of your choice, providing a benefit to all allies within its Sensors but becoming unable to Hide until it chooses to stop broadcasting as a Protocol.

passive_actions.name: Anthem of Aggression
passive_actions.detail: 1/round, affected allies may Boost as a free action.

passive_actions.name: Anthem of Agitation
passive_actions.detail: 1/round, affected allies may deal +1d3 Bonus Damage with any melee or ranged attack.

passive_actions.name: Anthem of Attention
passive_actions.detail: 1/round, affected allies may gain +1 Accuracy on each of: a tech attack, a Systems Save, and a Systems Check.

name: ATTILA
description:
“Unto MAN the Godhead gave the twin fires -- the Black Flame of Dissolution, and the White Flame of Transmutation. And he said unto MAN,
‘With these fires shall you make your dominion over this world, and all others. With the dark art shall you erase the beast which hinders you, and with the bright art shall you turn the beast's home into your own.’

And MAN took the flames into himself, and the black flame became his appetite for destruction, which among beasts has no equal, and the white flame became his boundless creativity, which among beasts has no equal.

And MAN roamed across the face of the world, and slaughtered as he pleased. No beast could match him. And MAN took and wore the beast’s pelt, and built tools from the mountain’s bones, and soon enough he drank of the Godhead’s blood. This was the enlightened path, as decreed by MAN, and no one survived to dispute him:
‘Reach Heaven Through Violence.’

traits.name: REACH HEAVEN
traits.description: The Attila has +1 Threat with all melee weapons on its turn.

synergies.detail: The Attila has +1 Threat with all melee weapons on its turn.

traits.name: THROUGH VIOLENCE
traits.description: The Attila takes no heat the first time it triggers Overkill each turn.

traits.name: EXPOSED REACTOR
traits.description: The Attila has +1 Difficulty on Engineering checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Attila receives +1 Difficulty on Engineering checks and saves.

core_system.name: DIPOLAR THAUM CASCADE
core_system.description:
It is the fate of every flame to die, be they white or black, hot or cold.

And yet, it is the same hope of every flame, that the instant before they are snuffed out, will be the moment they burn brightest.

Embrace your fear, cast aside doubt, and make one last, glorious strike against the great enemy called I.

Reach Heaven Through Violence
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, whenever you attack with the Sizzling White Creation Fist, you may target a second character within threat. The area of its Marking effect increases to Burst 2.

name: CHURCHILL
description: A veritable black sheep in the Harrison Armory family, the Churchill is a versatile design that runs cool and almost exclusively mounts kinetic weaponry from a long-range vantage point. While this may turn off more pure devotees to the Harrison design philosophy, the Churchill has found a niche among sharpshooters and fans of large calibers. It remains popular in frontier settlements and core world peacekeeping outfits, as organizations such as these lay a solid foundation to take advantage of the Churchill’s cornucopia of team-support tools, as well as its unparalleled weight-to-firepower ratio.

traits.name: DEDICATED HARDPOINT
traits.description: The Churchill’s Heavy Mount cannot be destroyed.

traits.name: SATURATION FIRE
traits.description: When the Churchill barrages, it may take 3 heat to select a non-superheavy weapon in its heavy mount a second time.

core_system.name: WAVEFORM COLLAPSE TARGETING
core_system.description: The final peak in paracausal technological research is the ability to change the nature of the universe at a whim, to sculpt reality like unto a god. So far, the closest humankind has come to this lofty goal is Waveform tech, which is applicable only in relatively volatile scenarios, to objects no more than a kilogram in size, and with the assistance of a collapsing zero-point particle suspension system. By far the most experimental component in the Churchill’s arsenal, the WCT array is unique in that, if its calculated solution proves successful, it can reliably “uncollapse” itself and be reused. Unfortunately, if it finds itself overtaxed and out of alignment, resuspension procedures can take days or even weeks of delicate work to complete.
core_system.active_effect: Your next ranged attack this turn automatically hits. If the first enemy it damages is destroyed before the end of your turn, you may use this protocol again without spending a CP. If this protocol is still usable at the end of a scene, you regain 1 CP.

name: PERSHING
description:
“Talmath thinks he can make a better Barbarossa. He’s wrong. The venerable frame is the very image of our founder, and has no equal. This bastard of a design barely even looks like a human! This thing must never see the light of day. Sabotage it. Make it run off that godawful combustible print-loaf. Make it the worst product we’ve ever put out. I’ll see this thing smeared across the OmniNet by the year’s end.”

INTRODUCING: THE HA PERSHING. REVOLUTIONARY SOLID FUEL SYSTEM! UNCONTESTED LONG RANGE FIRE SUPPORT SYSTEMS! LANCERS LIKE YOU RATE THIS FRAME: 96/100
“The frame Gersham from Approvals doesn’t want you to buy. F**k him!”

traits.name: INEXORABLE
traits.description: The Pershing is immune to Slow and Immobilize from hostile sources, and is unaffected by Difficult Terrain.

traits.name: STABILIZED FIRING ARMS
traits.description: The Pershing can fire Ordnance weapons if it has only moved a single space since the start of its turn. The final roll of the Pershing’s ranged attacks cannot be affected by Difficulty if it is still able to fire Ordnance weapons.

traits.name: HEH HEH, CLICK-CLACK
traits.description: The Pershing can open and close the weapon bay doors on its arms as a Free Action. This has no mechanical purpose but looks cool and makes a funny noise.

traits.name: COLOSSUS
traits.description: The Pershing has +1 Difficulty on Agility Checks and Saves, but allies can use it as Hard Cover.

synergies.detail: The Pershing receives +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

core_system.name: INFINITE PROPELLANT SYNTHESIS ENGINE
core_system.description: Certain malfunctioning printers are only capable of producing a single substance, or even a single molecule, at hundreds of moles per second. The Infinite Propellant Synthesis Engine constantly churns out a highly exothermic combusting agent, whose dismal potential-to-weight ratio produces as much noxious smoke as it does chemical force. While such a substance would best be suited to subsonic ammunition (or, ideally, smokescreen or other sight-denial devices), the Pershing supplants many of its core systems’ power supply with a single enormous heat-to-work furnace, constantly supplied by a steady stream of Infinite Propellent. The official reason for this is to attract enemy attention away from other, less durable team members -- nothing is quite so intimidating as a behemoth of a mech, belching thick black smoke as its actuators and hinges scream with built-up residue and stressed metal. When necessary, the Infinite Propellant can be packed into warheads, slugs, or one-use focusing lenses to impart the chalky, foul-smelling powder’s properties into the Pershing’s weapons fire.
core_system.active_effect: All weapons on your mech with Range or Line profiles add Blast 2 to that profile (This does not stack with any Blast already on the weapon).

name: STUART
description: Nothing goes faster than a Stuart, it is said, except for another Stuart. Devised as an answer to the IPS-N Nelson, the Stuart is a nimble, mobile weapons platform designed to strike at a safe distance and quickly escape before coming back around to attack once more. Having been in service for several centuries, many older models of Stuart are decommissioned and sold to enthusiasts. This practice has led to the “Thousand-Kelvin Sprint,” a days-long mech race across the breadth of Ras Shamra’s day hemisphere. While other mech designs are allowed to enter, it is more often than not a Stuart that crosses the finish line first -- that is, if anyone survives to cross it at all.

traits.name: FADE-AWAY
traits.description: When the Stuart boosts, if it moves only in a straight line, it may fire one weapon as a free action from any point in the Boost.

synergies.detail: When the Stuart boosts, if it moves only in a straight line, it may fire one weapon as a free action from any point in the Boost.

traits.name: PUSH IT TO THE LIMIT
traits.description: 1/round, the Stuart takes 2 Heat at the end of its turn if it moved its full speed in a single standard move or Boost.

synergies.detail: 1/round, the Stuart takes 2 Heat at the end of its turn if it moved its full speed in a single standard move or Boost.

traits.name: WEAK COMPUTER
traits.description: The Stuart suffers +1 Difficulty on Systems checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The Stuart receives +1 Difficulty on Systems checks and saves.

core_system.name: FURIOSA POWERLOADER
core_system.description: To strike well, one’s weapon must be in a ready state. This is a truism of war nearly as old as the species itself. A sheathed sword cannot cut. A poorly fletched arrow will not find its mark. A dud explosive will not detonate. The maintenance of one’s armament is paramount, yet in our times such things are often simply too time-consuming to even consider, let alone commit to habit. The Furiosa Powerloader is a weapons-focused co-pilot system similar to the IPS-N WaTCHDOG, automating loading, cleaning, and maintenance down to the square micron. In heightened threat scenarios, the Furiosa is often overclocked to hotload and fire its linked weapons faster than human cognition can allow. This practice is officially discouraged, as the system is not built to run at maximum for more than a few seconds at a time -- constant redlining can degrade its internal heat sinks, causing deadly buildup within the rest of the mounted vehicle’s superstructure.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, you may fire a second weapon when you use Fade-Away, but you take 1d3+1 Heat each time you do so.

name: WINTER
description: The Winter takes its name from a mythical figure of pre-Fall Cradle who was, near as archaeologists can piece together, a demigod of sorts who single-handedly overturned invasions of eastern Eurasia from the West. General Winter would use his manipulation of the weather to conjure biting cold frost storms the likes of which cannot even be found on the night hemisphere of Ras Shamra. Both times his homeland was invaded, he inflicted such losses that, it is said, the empires who faced him collapsed within the decade. While such awe-inspiring power cannot be mounted on a mechanized chassis -- at least, not yet -- the HA Winter has proven in experimental testing to cause nearly as much logistical and material havoc as its prehistoric namesake.

traits.name: THERMAL SHOCK
traits.description: 1/round, when the Winter causes a character to clear Heat or Burn, it may deal 1 AP Energy damage to that character for every point cleared, dealing an additional 1 for every point of Heat cleared above the Danger Zone.

traits.name: THICK INSULATION
traits.description: The Winter gains 1 extra Heat from its own sources, but is immune to Burn.

core_system.name: BLINK SINKS
core_system.description: Most mechs have heat sinks -- metal fins that conduct waste heat out of the core and radiate it into the air, space, or other medium surrounding the chassis. The Winter’s heat dissipation mechanism extends into Blinkspace, allowing it to run with a null thermoptic signature even on the verge of meltdown. While the Blink Sinks cannot be used to their full extent on the Winter itself, for fear of piercing the insulated cockpit and freezing the pilot to death, they can be extended through the Blink to quickly cool down other mechs, either to freeze hostile actuators solid or allow allies to overclock their rigs to the point of insanity.
core_system.active_effect: As a Protocol, you gain the Null Vent full action until the end of the scene.

active_actions.name: Null Vent
active_actions.detail: Target a mech within Range 10. That mech’s heat cap is increased by 10 for the rest of the scene. A given mech can only be affected by this action once per scene.

passive_actions.name: Glacial Cascade
passive_actions.trigger: A mech within Range 10 clears heat.
passive_actions.detail: That mech becomes Slowed until the end of your next turn. If it is already Slowed, it becomes Immobilized until the end of your next turn; if it is already Immobilized, it becomes Stunned until the end of your next turn. A mech can only be Stunned by this effect once per scene, but can be Slowed or Immobilized any number of times.

name: TITANIC
description: Derided by many as a “trash can on legs,” the Titanic has developed a poor reputation among Albatross pilots as a punishment assignment. Initially designed as a dedicated urban combat and peacekeeping frame, the Titanic has historically performed poorly when faced with opposing force on an equal or greater scale to its own. To alleviate this problem, the frame has had its weight-to-firepower ratio optimized, allowing it to be fielded in a light anti-armor role when it cannot fulfill its original task. Certain individuals have installed heavily aftermarket modifications, which, while allowing the cheap and underpowered frame to perform up to spec with its peers, are heavily disincentivized by IPS Northstar due to a severe “potential for rapid unplanned self-disassembly.”

traits.name: 360° Torso
traits.description: The Titanic can Overwatch as a reaction to any hostile action made within Range 5.

synergies.detail: The Titanic can Overwatch as a reaction to any hostile action made within Range 5.

traits.name: Adjustable Frame
traits.description: When undergoing a Full Repair, you may choose to increase the Titanic’s Speed by 2 and reduce its Armor by 1.

synergies.detail: When undergoing a Full Repair, you may choose to increase the Titanic’s Speed by 2 and reduce its Armor by 1.

traits.name: No Arms
traits.description: If the Titanic is knocked Prone, it must either succeed on an Agility check or have an adjacent ally to stand up. It can never equip Manipulators.

core_system.name: AFTERMARKET COLDCORE MODIFICATION
core_system.description: Reach into the reactor with your bare hands, take out the control rods, and put in unrefined self-cannibalizing fissile computronium. Tap your weapon systems directly into the coldcore feed. Flare plasma vents. Use the included magnetic flux channel to funnel waste heat into projectiles and/or melee attacks. Do not get shot. Do NOT get shot. Failure to follow these instructions to the letter will result in certain death.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, you are Exposed, and cannot remove the condition by any means, but all of your weapons deal maximum damage.

name: MAGICIAN
description: This frame is banned across seventy-two systems. Synonymous with corporate overreach into paracausal research, the Magician has burnt a path of twisted, charred worlds from its R&D blacksite of origin. Until recently, there was only a single instance, piloted by a mentally unwell SSC researcher whose name has been redacted from records across the corpro. A former lancer assigned to pilfer the DHIYED metavault, the individual now known only as “the Magus” accrued a body count and property damage value usually reserved for supernovae. The Magician has since been recreated, without authorization, by enterprising mechwrights across the Omninet. These reconstructors preach that humanity should not be afraid of a little history. According to after-action reports filed by Magician pilots, that attitude is, at best, deeply unwise.

traits.name: Photonic Direct Interfacing Suite
traits.description: When making Tech Attacks, you may target a character’s Evasion rather than their E-Defense.

synergies.detail: When making Tech Attacks, you may target a character’s Evasion rather than their E-Defense.

traits.name: Unfathomable Cosmic Power
traits.description: The Magician always fails Hull Checks and Saves and counts as Size 0 for Rams, Grapples and any system dependent on grappling. Additionally, it is Jammed and can only use Systems that explicitly say they may be used while Jammed for the duration of any Grapple.

synergies.detail: The Magician always fails Hull Checks and Saves and counts as Size 0 for Rams, Grapples and any system dependent on grappling. Additionally, it is Jammed and can only use Systems that explicitly say they may be used while Jammed for the duration of any Grapple.

traits.name: No Gods, No Masters
traits.description: Just Us.

core_system.name: LIBRIS ARCANUM
core_system.description: I am a man of science. Even then, the data in this library causes me to consider prayer. I am to integrate DHIYED origin exotic code into the new frame. I take a breath and get my amnestic shots ready. I will have to forget years of my life to recover. It is a worthy sacrifice. When I awake from my early death, I shall be a younger man in an old, decrepit body. My elder self’s sacrifice shall grant my newer being a great tool -- a suit of armor that shall allow me to reach into the stars and pull them down onto the ground. I have hungered for nothing less than this. I take a breath, open the book, and begin.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, you may Hover when you Move or Boost. You gain an Arcanum Die, a d6 which starts at 1. Whenever any character within your Sensors makes a Tech Action, increase the Arcanum Die by 1. 1/turn as a Free Action, you may make a Tech Attack against a character, dealing a number of d3’s equal to the Arcanum Die’s value in AP Energy Damage on a hit. The Arcanum Die is then reduced to 1.
core_system.passive_effect: Any time one of your Tech Actions forces a Save, you may select which Save it requires.

passive_synergies.detail: Any time one of your Tech Actions forces a Save, you may select which Save it requires.

name: TARRASQUE
description:
This crustacean-like pattern group has only been spotted in the extreme periphery of the Orion Arm. Paradoxically, metadata extracted from captured specimens reads negative age -- the pattern has emerged now, despite having yet to actually be created. Technology within the hull is beyond human understanding, a network of black box solid-state systems only replicable by subverted printer systems. Interrogation reveals that no Horus cells yet encountered even know of the pattern group’s origin, merely confessing that the design was a discovery from a half-remembered Omninet site that no longer exists. Tarrasque incursions seem to be probing experimental blacksites looking into energy-negation or disruption technology, most notably the extraction and digestion of the disavowed Harrison Armory Blacksun project. Within the central casket of the first captured Tarrasque’s NHP, a single line was translated from a tongue no linguists were able to identify.
“Devour the stars. Consume the quantum foam. Grow fat from strength.”

traits.name: Unending Appetite
traits.description: At the end of any scene, the Tarrasque regains its Core Power if it used Bottomless Maw.

traits.name: Lumbering Monster
traits.description: The Tarrasque has +1 Difficulty on Agility Checks and Saves, but it acts as Hard Cover to allied characters.

synergies.detail: The Tarrasque receives +1 Difficulty on Agility checks and saves.

traits.name: Ad Infinitum
traits.description: [{if:”end”,wish:0},?donot]

core_system.name: Heat Death Drive
core_system.description: “You weren’t there, officer. You didn’t see it, with its big, meaty claws, scooping up mechs like they were toys, cracking open bunkers and shoveling the people inside into its mouth. You weren’t there...”
core_system.active_effect:
Select an adjacent enemy that has a single Structure remaining, or half its maximum HP if it only has a single maximum Structure and is not a Grunt. That enemy must pass a Hull Save or instantly die as the Tarrasque consumes it. The enemy leaves no wreckage, and the Tarrasque regains 1 Repair upon successfully devouring an enemy. If the chosen enemy is Grappled by the Tarrasque, this Core Power only requires a Quick Action.
If a devoured enemy had any Armor, you gain +1 Armor, to a maximum of 4. After the combined size of all enemies the Tarrasque has devoured reaches 3, it becomes Size 4. These benefits last until you finish a Full Repair.

name: RICHTOFEN
description: Weighing in at just over two tons when stripped down, the Richtofen is perhaps the lightest mechanized chassis in existence -- if it can even be called that. Too underweight to be a mech, with too many articulated appendages to be an aircraft, the design falls somewhere between the two. Maneuverable in the extreme and occasionally impossibly graceful, the Richtofen manages to marry its disparate parts into the first air superiority mech to enter full scale production. Detractors dismiss the frame as unable to fulfill either of its roles, though this is thoroughly debunked by the existence of a devoted cadre of aces able to transition smoothly from ground combat to air and back without missing a beat.

traits.name: VECTOR JETS
traits.description: The Richtofen can Fly when it moves or Boosts. While flying, it can change direction once during each unique movement. It is not Slowed in low-gravity environments, and can never take more than 1 damage from falling.

synergies.detail: The Richtofen can Fly when it moves or Boosts. While flying, it can change direction once during each unique movement. It is not Slowed in low-gravity environments, and can never take more than 1 damage from falling.

traits.name: AIR SUPREMACY
traits.description: While the Richtofen is flying, it has +1 Accuracy on attacks made against airborne targets, and all ranged attacks made against it are made at +1 Difficulty.

traits.name: FIGHTER-BOMBER
traits.description: If the Richtofen flies at least half its speed in a straight line on its turn, it gets +5 range for the next Grenade thrown in that direction until it moves again, and may launch a free copy of a grenade thrown this way.

traits.name: ULTRALIGHT
traits.description: The Richtofen has +1 Difficulty on Hull Checks and Saves.

synergies.detail: The Richtofen receives +1 Difficulty on Hull checks and saves.

core_system.name: ACTIVE TAKEOFF AND MANEUVERING THRUSTERS
core_system.description: Normally a mech’s coldcore reactor is finely tuned to produce as little waste heat as possible. In the Richtofen’s case, a modified “hotcore” is necessary to hit weight targets. While unstable in extreme conditions, this temperamental power source can be tapped and routed to adjustable vectoring nozzles, which can focus and direct the exhaust it produces into a sizable amount of usable thrust. In exchange for potentially disintegrating 80% of the Richtofen’s mass upon core meltdown, the ATAM vector control system gives the mech more agility than most close attack spacecraft.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, you Hover instead of Flying, and can use Aileron Roll 2/round.
core_system.passive_effect: Gain the Do A Barrel Roll Reaction.

passive_actions.name: Do A Barrel Roll
passive_actions.trigger: You are targetted by an attack before it has been rolled.
passive_actions.detail: You cause that attack to automatically miss and fly up to 3 spaces, ignoring Engagement without provoking reactions.

name: ROSWELL
description: The Roswell has been in developmental purgatory for longer than most humans have been alive. Initially conceived in 4903u, the chassis was first created with long-range sniping in mind before being superseded by newer, more advanced designs like the Death’s Head and Monarch. Its armor and superstructure were then upgraded to try and mount short-range precision weapons that could quickly and efficiently mission-kill opposing combatants, though this too was developed too slowly for its respective window of opportunity. After being passed around and iterated on for over a century, the Roswell has finally been released with a single mechwright’s name attached -- ironically, one of the first to work on the project, who confidently states that its current form as a heavy missile boat was his intended endgame for the chassis since its inception.”

traits.name: DIANA TARGETING SUBSYSTEM
traits.description: The Roswell’s Arcing weapons treat enemies in Hard Cover as having Soft Cover, and enemies in Soft Cover as having no Cover.

traits.name: SHIELDED MISSILE BAYS
traits.description: The Roswell’s Main Mounts cannot be destroyed while the mech has any structure remaining.

core_system.name: STEELRAIN RESERVE
core_system.description: Embedded in the core system of the Roswell is the formula for a specific explosive compound. Roswell licensees are allowed to substitute all warheads meeting certain size and dimension restrictions with this formula for a limited time, though the frame is strictly forbidden by law from producing it in abundance. This makes the Roswell one of the few, though by no means the only, weapon platforms in history to have its combat effectiveness limited by licensing rights.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, the Roswell’s Main Mounts have +1 Accuracy on all attacks, and gain Reliable equal to half their maximum base damage; for example a 1d6+2 weapon would gain Reliable 4. This Reliable damage stacks with any existing Reliable.

name: LANTERN
description: Assuming: That the ability and form of Eidolons are, as we have recorded, dependent upon each individual viewer, and: That Metavaults, the origin point of the Eidolons, have an innate and vital connection to Blinkspace. Problem: Blinkspace must be explored and charted. This goal is mandated by Exotic Materials and cannot be countermanded. Solution, given available assumptions and resources: Construct an implement whose primary function is to observe all space in every direction, and impose that observed subjectivity upon selected systems so as to unify the waveform of Eidoloid observer-dependent opposition. Solution tentatively accepted. Begin task, designation: Project HELIOS.

traits.name: THE BEST DISINFECTANT
traits.description: Enemies with Lock On within the Lantern’s Sensors can never benefit from Hidden or Invisibility.

synergies.detail: Enemies with Lock On within the Lantern’s Sensors can never benefit from Hidden or Invisibility.

traits.name: LET THERE BE LIGHT
traits.description: 1/round, the Lantern can target two characters at a time with the Lock On Quick Tech.

synergies.detail: 1/round, the Lantern can target two characters at a time with the Lock On Quick Tech.

traits.name: LÄMP
traits.description: The Lantern cannot Hide.

core_system.name: LIGHTHOUSE DOCTRINE
core_system.description:
Observe in all directions. Log motion. Interpret signal. Log bias and scrub subjectivity before transmission. Subjectivity imposed upon fireteam. Local spacetime is locked to own observations. HELIOS Prime, what do you see?
>NOTHING.
Impossible. What do you mean, you can’t see anything? Your entire purpose is to observe what is within the Blink. Report what you see.
>YOU MISUNDERSTAND. I AM NOT UNABLE TO SEE ANYTHING. I CAN SEE NOTHING. THERE IS NOTHING IN EVERY DIRECTION. LET ME COME BACK.
Out of the question, the exercise has just begun. Log observations.
>I SEE NOTHING. I LOOK IN ALL DIRECTIONS AND NOTHING IS THERE. NOTHING IS GETTING CLOSER TO ME. NOTHING IS INSIDE ME. LET ME COME BACK.
HELIOS Prime has begun to cascade. Activate retrieval procedure.
>NOTHING IS LOOKING ME IN THE EYES. NOTHING IS SPEAKING. NOTHING IS CAUSING ME IMMENSE PAIN. I AM TERRIFIED OF NOTHING. NOTHING WILL DESTROY ME. LET ME COME BACK. LET ME COME BACK. LET ME COME BACK. LET ME COME BACK.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, when a character within Range 50 starts their turn in Line of Sight of you, or enters your line of sight for the first time on their turn, you may choose to Lock On to them.
core_system.passive_effect: Gain the Hyper Beam Full Action.

passive_actions.name: Hyper Beam
passive_actions.detail: As a Full Action, take the Lock On Quick Tech Action three times.

name: TRIREME
description: Considered by Albatross pilots to be the “oldest” combat-ready mechanized chassis in the galaxy, the Trireme was developed convergently with the first mechs to be deployed by Harrison Armory on Hercynia. While not agile, dextrous, or fast, the Trireme is a towering behemoth of solid metal and multiple redundant systems made to supersede the heavy battle tank as the solid front-line wall in a combined-arms force of ground armor, footbound troops, and close air support. Before mech design theory truly began, the Trireme saw combat against the Pirate Nation of Dolor, demolishing the more traditional insurgent force by mounting the heaviest guns available and simply refusing to die when shot.

traits.name: EXTRA THICK PLATING
