traits.description: The Trireme has Resistance to AP Damage.

traits.name: IT'S ALL ANALOG
traits.description: The Trireme cannot make Tech Attacks and has +1 Difficulty on Systems Checks and Saves, but all Tech Attacks made against it have +1 Difficulty.

synergies.detail: The Trireme receives +1 Difficulty on Systems checks and saves.

traits.name: STONE TITAN
traits.description: The Trireme is Immune to involuntary movement. Allies can use the Trireme as Hard Cover and are also Immune to involuntary movement whilst benefiting from this cover.

core_system.name: REACTIVE ARMOR
core_system.description: A pre-Fall concept, Reactive Armor is simply an outward-facing fragmentation explosive that “shoots down” incoming projectiles on a proximity trigger. More modern variants add a simple actuator system that can angle plating on the fly to create less favorable penetration angles. Use of Reactive Armor as an offensive tool is frowned upon as a reckless and needlessly dangerous tactic -- which of course led to early Trireme pilots favoring it against smaller opposing forces.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, your Armor value is doubled. Additionally, 1/round as a reaction when an enemy within Range 8 successfully hits you with an attack, you may cause that enemy to take 3 AP Explosive.

name: HELLKNIGHT
description: If you are reading this manifest, it means that I am dead. To you, I pass this technology. I was gifted this mech and its many tools by a previous owner, who in turn received it in kind from their own predecessor. I am not the first to wear it, and you will hopefully not be the last. We do not know where it comes from, and we do not know who designed it. All we have is an account of the original bearer’s dreams, a set of designs and schematics I cannot hope to understand, and a mandate to bring Order to a chaotic and uncaring universe. To you I leave this responsibility: Take up my armor and wear it well. Avenge my death, if at all possible. Take up an apprentice of your own, for you shall surely follow me one day. And above all else, leave the universe a better place than when you arrived.

traits.name: SWARM SHIELDING
traits.description: 1/round, when the Hellknight attacks with a Nexus weapon, it gains Resistance to a damage type of its choice until the start of its next turn.

traits.name: DOOM DRAGOON
traits.description: Enemies within the Hellknight’s Sensors cannot reduce damage from it in any way.

core_system.name: ARBITRATION PROTOCOL
core_system.description: That I shall never succeed in this task is no reason not to pursue it. Disorder may be all around me, but I will not allow it to overcome me. Never shall I fail so again. There shall be order. There shall be law. You ask me, by whose laws shall I be governed? By whose authority am I to be ruled? You do not realize that these questions are their own answer.
core_system.active_effect: Until the end of the scene, Swarm Shielding affects two damage types of your choice. In addition, Doom Dragoon also ignores enemy Immunities, and prevents affected enemies from reducing damage from any source, not just the Hellknight.

name: ARCHDEVIL
description: Humankind did not get to where it is by being afraid of the new or the unfamiliar. It is my proposal that, rather than dismiss HORUS as a rogue terrorist group, Union should seek to entreat with them as a new facet of sentience. To this end, I have made contact with a Deimosian who has agreed, in exchange for token gestures of devotion and material offerings, to provide the members of this research initiative with objects and materials related to our ongoing research into the nature of NHPs and paracausal technologies. This Deimosian’s name is Dispater, and his first gift to us is this frame: The Archdevil. He runs all systems from within the Blink, allowing the frame to be more streamlined and agile in our dimension than its Pattern Group cousins. Just think -- by mounting this frame, you are as close to touching a Deimosian as a human could conceivably get. Dispater insists we call this initiative his cult, but I am confident that through scientific rigor and a disciplined mind, we can leverage it into great gains for all mankind.

traits.name: PACT MAGIC
traits.description: The Archdevil’s Limited Systems and Weapons do not gain extra charges from your Limited Systems Bonus. Instead, whenever you rest, you gain back a number of charges of your Limited Systems and Weapons equal to your Limited Systems Bonus +1, split however you like.

traits.name: HURL THROUGH HELL
traits.description: When the Archdevil Barrages, it may forgo all attacks with a second mount to give its first attack +1 Accuracy, Blast 1, and Seeking.

core_system.name: EXISTENTIAL DISPLACEMENT ENGINE
core_system.description:
>DIS: okay so I’m gonna have to dumb this down a lot for you to understand
>DIS: but here we go
>DIS: there are these little undersea critters on Cradle called Mantis Shrimp
>DIS: vicious bastards
>DIS: literally punch their prey so hard it causes a vacuum bubble that explodes
>DIS: if, you know, the concussion didn’t kill them already
>DIS: so I figured my trademark would be a gun that does that
>DIS: but instead of water, the cavitation bubble is being made in
>DIS: like
>DIS: reality
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, your Wraithfire may attack 3 different targets at once.

name: FARRAGUT
description: Rarely do officers in space consider the efforts of planetbound navies to be worthy of notice. IPS-N does not share this sentiment. The Albatross has a long and storied history of naval combat, both in space and in the water, and mechanized chassis have their place in both. Designed as a purpose-built marine invader, the Farragut is in its element while up to its armpits in saltwater, pounding a distant shoreline as allied troops move up in relative safety. The Farragut’s role has expanded from amphibious invasion to include watercraft escort and submersible combat, though it is no less effective on land when functioning as heavy fire support. Detractors point out that the design is top-heavy, over-specialized, and slow outside of its home turf. Dedicated Farragut pilots relish the opportunity to prove such naysayers wrong.

traits.name: SYNCHRONIZED FIRING ARMS
traits.description: When the Farragut Barrages to fire two Main weapons, both attacks gain +1 Accuracy.

traits.name: DAMN THE TORPEDOES
traits.description: The Farragut is Immune to Mines and is not Slowed underwater.

traits.name: WATERLOGGED GYRO
traits.description: The Farragut has +1 Difficulty on all attacks made as Reactions.

core_system.name: “BEACHHEAD” HOTLOADER
core_system.description: The Farragut’s internal loading mechanism frequently runs hot due to the demands of long-range saturation shelling. The usual solution to this is obvious -- expose the weatherproofed internals to the freezing cold of the surrounding ocean. When not submerged in low-temperature bilge, the Farragut is equipped with an onboard supply of supercooled saline solution that fills the same function in reverse -- the firing chamber is flooded and sealed so as to vent as little coolant as possible. This reserve is only useful for so long until it reaches thermal saturation, after which point it must be vented and topped off before reuse. The sight of a Farragut rising from the ocean, cracking open its firing breech and releasing a prismatic cloud of vaporized coolant, is known to have inspired at least one poem by a local angler.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the Scene, the Farragut’s Synchronized Firing Arms trait is disabled, but you may fire any Main Weapon selected Twice as part of the Barrage.

name: GERONIMO
description: Originally an agricultural chassis exclusively used to fell the bountiful sessile organisms of Anemone IV, the Geronimo was rapidly pressed into service as a militia mech during the planet’s infamous Biosphere Revolt. With an overhauled engine, upgraded armament, and its trademark Harrison Industrial cutting tools, the Geronimo was at the forefront of Anemone IV’s brutal and grinding thirty-year war with nature. Surviving pilots who served during the conflict are described as haunted, tormented souls, perhaps from the decades of constant vigilance and horrific organisms they were forced to fight. It is said in the Anemone system that the Geronimo is cursed from that dark time, doomed to be a tool of suffering and destruction. While this reputation has effectively killed the frame in its home system, it has only bolstered its sales in the galaxy at large, where it enjoys a role as a nigh unstoppable close-quarters juggernaut.

traits.name: Heavy Swings
traits.description: The Geronimo has two Heavy Mounts, but cannot mount Superheavy weapons. It can only attack with one Heavy weapon per turn.

traits.name: LACERATE AND DISARM
traits.description: When the Geronimo causes a character to take a point of Structure Damage, the Geronimo may force the character to not make a Structure Check, and instead suffer System Trauma. You may decide if a System or Weapon is destroyed, but the character still decides which one.

traits.name: METALLURGIC CANNIBALISM
traits.description: When a character within the Geronimo’s Threat is reduced to 0 HP or suffers System Trauma, the Geronimo gains 1 Repair. If the Geronimo would gain a Repair above its Repair Cap, it may choose to either immediately spend the Repair as a Free Action to regain half its HP, or retain the extra Repair until the end of its next Rest.

core_system.name: RAPID DISASSEMBLY PROCESSOR
core_system.description: Hello, trainee! Welcome to the Harrison Industrial crash course in piloting the Geronimo Heavy Lumberjack. Central to the frame’s function is the Rapid Disassembly Processor, or RDP. Your RDP will let you analyze, evaluate, and swiftly cut down any - [goddamn flesh trees] - sessile lumber-bearing organisms you are assigned to process. The RDP will point you to viable cutting points, such as - [tendons, joints, sensory organs] - notches, roots, and exposed timber veins. Once felled, you will be responsible for - [finishing the job] - disassembling the timber and preparing it for disposal by removing any remaining - [limbs] - limbs. Enjoy the following tutorial, and have a safe and productive day at Harrison Industrial!
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the scene, you may attack with any number of mounted Heavy weapons in a turn. If you hit a target with two different Heavy weapons in a single turn, it must make a Hull save or immediately suffer System Trauma.

traits.name: SOL-CORE REACTOR
traits.description: At the end of its turn, the Flarewing clears Heat equal to ¼ of its Heat Cap.

traits.name: URBAN TERRAIN MOVEMENT SUITE
traits.description: The Flarewing climbs and swims at normal speed, ignores difficult terrain, and when making a standard move, can jump horizontally up to its full Speed and upwards up to half its Speed (in any combination). The Flarewing does not fall until the end of its turn when it jumps.

traits.name: REACTOR GREMLIN
traits.description: Enemies within the Flarewing’s Sensors subtract 1 from the final result of any Overheating Check, or 2 if the Flarewing is in the Danger Zone.

traits.name: HEAVY REACTOR INTEGRATION
traits.description: When the Flarewing takes a point of Structure damage, it must succeed on an Engineering Check or make a Stress Check.

core_system.name: ANARCHOCYCLOTRON
core_system.description:
1. DO NOT TOUCH UNTIL THIRTY MINUTES AFTER TURNING OFF. KEEP YOUR FINGERS.
  2. IF YOU HEAR A HIGH PITCHED WHINING NOISE, LAND IMMEDIATELY.
  3. 3. YOU WILL KNOW WHEN IT IS APPROPRIATE TO HIT THE BIG RED BUTTON.
core_system.active_effect: You vent all of your Heat into a fiery inferno that engulfs the entire battlefield. All characters of your choice within Range 50 must pass an Engineering Save or take Heat and Burn equal to half of your vented Heat, taking half, again, on a successful save. This clears all of your heat and bypasses Reactor Override’s restriction.

passive_actions.name: Reactor Override
passive_actions.detail: Gain enough Heat to enter the Danger Zone. You cannot clear Heat this turn except by Overheating. The first time you cause a character to gain Heat this turn, it gains +2 Heat.

name: GIAP
description: Spy-Guy Mech

traits.name: FARADAY SKELETON
traits.description: Enemies attempting to Search for the Giap have +1 Difficulty on their Systems check.

traits.name: RIGHT BEHIND YOU
traits.description: When the Giap attacks while Hidden, the first successful hit becomes a Critical Hit and you are treated as the same size as the enemy if you are attempting to Grapple or Ram them. If the target is destroyed by this attack, the Giap does not lose Hidden.

synergies.detail: When the Giap attacks while Hidden, the first successful hit becomes a Critical Hit and you are treated as the same size as the enemy if you are attempting to Grapple or Ram them. If the target is destroyed by this attack, the Giap does not lose Hidden.

core_system.name: KAIJU-Class Molecular Cloaking Apparatus
core_system.description: Enough radiation can mask your presence from any form of sensor, even someone's eyes.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the Scene, the Giap may Hide and end its turn Hidden even without cover, in addition, any enemies that start their turn or move adjacent to the Giap for the first time on a turn suffer 3 Heat.
core_system.passive_effect: The Giap may choose not to deploy normally at the start of combat, instead deploying in disguise. At the start of an enemy mech’s turn, so long as that mech has not dealt damage to or taken damage from the Giap’s allies, the Giap may reveal itself to have been disguised as that mech, deploying itself in its position. The actual enemy is revealed to have been waylaid and hidden in a position up to Range 5 from the Giap of your choice, only now reactivating and joining the battle.

traits.name: UNSTOPPABLE
traits.description: While Slowed, the POLYPHEMUS gains Immunity to Immobilize.

traits.name: TOP-HEAVY
traits.description: The POLYPHEMUS has +1 Difficulty on saves and checks against being knocked prone and may only move in straight lines when it Boosts.

core_system.name: 108 Forms of Vengeance
core_system.description: The “Vengeful Eye”, the system that the Polyphemus was named for, is an advanced targeting computer using a specialized sensor cluster stylistically designed to resemble a single, gigantic eye.  The prototype version was powerful but clunky, able to consistently pluck any system or weapon out of a target with the assistance of a target lock. The system has been reconfigured to be more opportunistic, instead identifying structural weaknesses and guiding user movement to best exploit openings in the enemy's movements via neural integration, trading surgical removal of systems in favor of gross structural damage. This combined with a bank of martial arts techniques designed to turn enemy's movements against them makes the Polyphemus a powerful and precise frame, achieving the design team's goal of a flexible and crushingly strong front-line brawler that does not sacrifice SSC's brand of luxury and mobility.
core_system.active_effect:
You take on the most deceptive form built into the POLYPHEMUS’s datacore of Martial Arts, inviting impending doom on any that do not see past the facade or are simply blind to its true nature.

Until the end of your next turn, enemies within Range 3 of the POLYPHEMUS may choose to gain up to 3 Accuracy on all of their Attacks that target the POLYPHEMUS. If they attack the POLYPHEMUS during the duration of this ability, they become Exposed after the Attack resolves and additionally must make a Hull Save with a number of Difficulty equal to the Accuracy on the Attack or be knocked Prone and Slowed until the end of their next turn.

If the POLYPHEMUS is not attacked by any enemy during the duration of this ability, you regain CP at the end of the scene.
core_system.passive_effect: Gain access to the Shun-Goku-Satsu Reaction. Additionally, the POLYTHEMEUS’s Melee Critical Hits can not have their damage reduced in any way and bypass any immunity to damage the target(s) may have.

passive_actions.name: Shun-Goku-Satsu
passive_actions.trigger: You cause an adjacent Character to lose a point of Structure.
passive_actions.detail: The die result of that structure check is treated as 2 lower, minimum 1.

name: DANTE
description: Originally, IPS-N designed the DANTE to cut into HA markets, combining qualities from the GENGHIS and TOKUGAWA. Without HA systems, it excelled at neither, and was backlogged indefinitely. In a more direct push into HA dealings, IPS-N’s RAID division specializes in acquisition and reverse engineering of rival tech. Off the books, of course. One of their successful raids on a Harrison Armory Blacksite recovered several designs. One of which was a rejected core reactor for the TOKUGAWA - the “Inferno Drive”. The overworked engineer who produced it had noted that it would make the Tokugawa “A death trap on legs”. Ignoring this warning, a prototype of the Inferno Drive was created, and installed on a few IPS-N mainstays, with abysmal results. Eventually, the Dante was tested as a recipient. The mech tore its way through the testing grounds, and promptly collapsed in a flaming wreck. Nevertheless, the DANTE had shown its potential. Able to reach breakneck speeds, leaving a trail of fire in its wake, the DANTE finally stands out on its own, no longer just IPS-N’s pale imitation of Harrison Armory.

traits.name: OVERCLOCKED COMBUSTION ENGINE
traits.description: 1/Round, you may take 4 Burn Damage to Boost as a Free Action.

actions.name: Burning Overclock
actions.detail: Take 4 Burn Damage to Boost as a Free Action.

traits.name: REACTIVE FLAME VENTING
traits.description: When an Enemy makes an Overwatch Attack against you, they take 2 Burn Damage and you take 1 Burn Damage.

traits.name: SYNTHETIC ASBESTOS COATING
traits.description: You have Resistance to Burn, and you have +1 Accuracy on all Engineering Saves and Checks

synergies.detail: The Dante receives +1 Accuracy on Engineering checks and saves.

core_system.name: INFERNO DRIVE
core_system.description: While the combat benefits are impressive, the Inferno Drive has a much more interesting factor. In outer rim “stunt courses”, the DANTE's breakneck speeds and trail of fire it leaves in its wake is unrivaled for energizing audiences. The DANTE tends to attract adrenaline junkies. Hopefully they’ll survive when the mech eventually crashes and burns.
core_system.active_effect: Any time you would increase the value of your Inferno Die, instead increase it by double that value.
core_system.passive_effect:
You gain an Inferno Die, 1d20 starting at 1. When you take Damage, you increase the Inferno Die by that value. Whenever you deal Damage, increase the value of the Inferno Die by 1. Whenever you Stabilize, decrease your Inferno Die by 5.

Based on the value of your Inferno Die, gain the following Traits:
  • 9 or more: You may move an additional 2 spaces as part of your Boost.
    • 12 or more: Whenever you Boost, all Enemies adjacent to spaces you move through must pass an Agility save or take 2 Burn damage.
      • 15 or more: You may move an additional 2 spaces as part of your Boost.
        • 18 or more: You increase the Burn damage from the 12 or More effect effect by 1, and characters that have to make the Agility Save have +1 Difficulty on the Save.
          • 20: You may reset the Inferno Die to 1, and your next Weapon Attack deals +1d6 Burn Damage and +1d6 Heat on a successful Hit.

traits.name: EARTHGLIDE
traits.description: The XORN treats Terrain, Objects and Cover as Intangible for the purposes of its movement. It can share its space with any number of other objects, parts of Terrain or Cover, so long as it is occupying two open spaces.

synergies.detail: The XORN treats Terrain, Objects and Cover as Intangible for the purposes of its movement. It can share its space with any number of other objects, parts of Terrain or Cover, so long as it is occupying two open spaces.

traits.name: STONESKIN
traits.description: While adjacent to Hard Cover, or sharing a space with Terrain or Cover with Earthglide, the XORN gains +1 Armor (To a Maximum of 4 Armor).

traits.name: RUBBLE
traits.description: When the XORN is destroyed or self destructs, it leaves nothing behind except a Size 1 piece of Hardcover with Evade 5, 2 Armor and HP equal to half the Xorn’s. The Pilot then appears adjacent to the Rubble in the nearest Free Space.

core_system.name: TERRAFIRMA FOESEEKER SUITE
core_system.description: A series of ballistics calculation-subroutines and mass-scanner arrays that plan and project trajectories onto the Lancer's hud, locking on to nearby high-density theatre-pieces adjacent to the desired target. Native improvements in the mounts are fitted to attached weapons to allow for theatre-agnostic target acquisition and firing solutions. Problems in the magnetic-rebound charge coils means the bulk of the penetration power is spent in the hyper-efficient Earthglide properties imparted on projectiles, resulting in no appreciable reduction in the effectiveness of cover.
core_system.active_effect: For the rest of the Scene, your Attacks and saves you force do not require Line of Sight so long as the target is Adjacent to any Terrain, Object or Piece of Cover.

active_synergies.detail: For the rest of the Scene, your Attacks and saves you force do not require Line of Sight so long as the target is Adjacent to any Terrain, Object or Piece of Cover.

name: MUSASHI
description:
“...The hell do you mean, banned in the Karrakin Trade Baronies! Wai-wai-wait. It was banned because it destroyed too many heirloom Atlas suits? HAH! Call Marketing and see if we can get contacts to keep selling them.” -Chief Engineer Talmath

The Harrison Armory Musashi project was originally started as a more aggressive bodyguard unit for unarmored VIPs. Most designs in the Armory feature blocky, geometric designs, while the Musashi favors sleeker curves, looking more like an overly built sporting hardsuit rather than a weapon of war. Underneath the hood, however, Harrison Armory’s technical expertise comes to the fore, featuring the usual hallmarks of Harrison Armory design schools borrowed from such vaunted frames as the Napoleon, Saladin and Tokugawa.

traits.name: UNREASONABLE DUELIST
traits.description: If it is Engaged the MUSASHI gains Soft Cover, and may apply the benefits of Soft Cover against melee attacks. If the Musashi is at 2 Structure or less, this becomes Hard Cover instead.

traits.name: SHIELDED SCABBARDS
traits.description: The MUSASHI can make Melee Attacks while Jammed.

synergies.detail: The MUSASHI can make Melee Attacks while Jammed.

traits.name: NO TIME FOR RANGEFINDING
traits.description: The MUSASHI suffers an additional difficulty when using Ranged Attacks. In addition, all Ranged Weapons have their range, cone, or line values reduced by half.

synergies.detail: The MUSASHI suffers an additional difficulty when using Ranged Attacks. In addition, all Ranged Weapons have their range, cone, or line values reduced by half.

traits.name: EXPOSED REACTOR
traits.description: The MUSASHI suffers +1 Difficulty on ENGINEERING checks and saves.

synergies.detail: The MUSASHI suffers +1 Difficulty on ENGINEERING checks and saves.

core_system.name: The Book Of Those Other Rings
core_system.description:
“Do you really have to yell that every time?”
“Yes… shut up! It doesn’t work if you don’t yell that.”
“...Why would Talmath do that?”
core_system.active_effect: When you activate this, clear the Slowed and Immobilized Conditions, then move 10 spaces forward, attacking every enemy within threat with the Focused profile on the Masamune. This movement does not trigger Reactions, allows you to move through other Characters’ spaces, and ignores Engagement. Objects and Terrain that you pass within your Threat automatically take 40 AP Energy Damage.

name: PHOENIX
description: HORUS mech designers (and discoverers) come from all backgrounds and they approach creation from many directions. The Phoenix owes its creation to paracausal scientists and flash-printer engineers. Assembled in seconds and deployable anywhere from a remote blinkspace pocket, Phoenix pilots are never far from their frames. That is the extent of the frame’s bleeding-edge capabilities – once the rickety mech materializes onto the field its shortcomings are obvious and unending. Still-cooling weapons suffer from atrocious inaccuracy, materials suited for rapid printing make mediocre armor and terrifyingly inferior frame supports, and the only reactor that fits inside is champing at the bit to detonate at the first mechanical failure. Proponents of the Phoenix remain adamant: The ejection seat always works and a new frame is always waiting to replace the last. You can’t beat that new mech smell.

traits.name: One-Hit Wonder
traits.description: Whenever the Phoenix takes structure damage, it does not make a Structure Damage check. Instead it begins an Irreversible Meltdown as per the Overheating Table.

traits.name: Eclipse Phase
traits.description: While the Phoenix is Exposed or undergoing an Irreversible Meltdown, it has +1 accuracy on all attacks, checks, and saves.

traits.name: Minimalist Magazines
traits.description: Repair Points, Core Points, and Limited systems are only restored upon Full Repair. All consumable systems have 1 use per deployed mech. You may only have as many consumables per mission as you would normally.

core_system.name: Rapid Insertion Protocol
core_system.description: The Glaucus Gang have conquered a metavault. At least that’s what they claim. A mighty Eidolon has been deposed of its throne. They say that this space-beyond space has been repurposed as a - defying printer. They say that time is extremely subjective inside the vault and that’s how orders are completed immediately. It’s not even hard to contact the Gang, some say. A cooperatively controlled metavault, if you can imagine that sort of thing. There’s a public donation omni address. Rumor has it that when intel, materials, krait, or even beer are donated in suitable amounts, you’ll be sent a remote targeting device. Also a copy of minutes from the last board meeting.
core_system.active_effect: Activate this core power only if the Phoenix is undergoing an Irreversible Meltdown. When destroyed due to reactor meltdown, characters within Burst 2 must succeed on an Agility save or take 8d6 Energy damage. On a success, they only take half damage. Afterwards, place a new Phoenix in a free space within Range 5 at full structure and stress, with all of its systems and weapon mounts, and powered up. Place the pilot within, mounted. The CP remains spent.
core_system.passive_effect: While the Phoenix is destroyed or undergoing Irreversible Meltdown, its dismounted pilot can spend 1 Repair to use the Be Reborn Quick Action.

passive_actions.name: Be Reborn
passive_actions.detail: Mark a free space within Range 5. At the beginning of the pilot’s next turn, a new Phoenix appears from blinkspace at full structure and stress, with all of its systems and weapon mounts, and powered up. It has Resistance to all damage until its next turn.

name: RACKHAM
description: A much more lithe mech than IPS-N’s traditional mechs, the Rackham is a swiss army knife of a mech. Instead of specializing in a single weapon type, the RACKHAM elects to carry them all. For every weapon it wields, it’s PENDULUM system incorporates it into a flawless assault. Many find it quite meditative, if you can ignore what it’s doing to your enemies. For a man with a hammer, all his problems look like nails. For a man with an OmniTool, he does not have problems. (Art from https://emersontung.com)

traits.name: HURRICANE BANDOLIER
traits.description: When the RACKHAM Barrages, it can take 3 Heat to select a third mount. Attacks made with that mount during a Barrage do Half Damage, Burn and Heat.

traits.name: LOYALTY TO THE ARMAMENTS
traits.description: You cannot gain or change any Weapon Mounts, including integrated Weapon Mounts. All weapons gain the “Unique” tag.

core_system.name: Style of the Pendulum
core_system.active_effect: Any time you would force a Target to make a save, They do it at +1 Difficulty. Additionally, you may select a second weapon with HURRICANE BANDOLIER, for a total of four selected weapons during a barrage, also dealing half Damage, Burn and Heat.
core_system.description: <i>In testing, IPS-N was pleased to see the RACKHAM wield up to 6 unique weapons with efficiency and ease. Pleased, but not ecstatic. To bring the RACKHAM up to their standards, a modification was added to the RACKHAM that causes a positive feedback loop, increasing the effectiveness drastically.
core_system.passive_effect:
Your Weapons gain the following effects based on their type. If a weapon has multiple types, you may only pick one of these effects.
  • Melee: +1d6 Damage if the Target is Prone. On Hit: Target makes a Engineering Save or becomes Impaired.
  • CQB: +1 Accuracy if the Target is Impaired. On Hit: Target makes a Hull Save or becomes Shredded.
  • Rifle: +1 Accuracy if the Target is Shredded. On Hit: Target makes an Agility Save or becomes Slowed.
  • Nexus: +1 Accuracy if the Target is Slowed. On Hit: Target makes a Systems Save or becomes Locked-On.
  • Launcher: If you consume Lock-On, you ignore Cover and Engagement. On Hit: Target makes a Systems Save or becomes unable to make Tech Actions until the start of your next turn.
  • Cannon: +1 Accuracy if the Target is unable to make Tech Actions. On Hit: Target makes a Hull Save or becomes Prone.

name: HAWK MOTH
description: “Oh, ExMats thought they could do some cool shit with Witness and all that? Fuck those guys. The Emperor is a primitive piece of shit. Using an artificial ‘Witness’ gestalt link, you can direct drone and nexus units with an ease that embarasses some ‘poggerz Hydra jock.’ Some days we need to remind Corporate that we are also an arms manufacturer and need to act like it.” --Chief Engineer Yumiko Arasaka

traits.name: A Beautiful Death
traits.description: After successfully attacking with a Nexus, the Hawk Moth gains an additional Accuracy with Weapon Attacks on the target. Only one target may be affected by this at a time. This effect persists until the end of the scene.

traits.name: Illusion Field
traits.description: Enemies that have been successfully damaged by any Nexus or Drones controlled by the Hawk Moth suffer an additional Difficulty on attacks until the end of their next turn.

core_system.name: All Range Nexus
core_system.description: “Yeah, so, using Witness as a cheap version of IPS-N’s ACESO drones is a stupid waste of that technology. Being able to push Directives with the mind would be much more useful for say, drone control.”
core_system.active_effect:
Until the end of the scene, all Nexus weapons may chain to an additional target within range of the initial target. This attack deals half damage and may not do bonus damage. Any targets that are Locked On and have the Lock On consumed may have one of the following Effects applied to them on a failed save:
  • Destroying Earth: The Target must make a Hull Save or be Shredded until the end of their next turn.
  • Driving Winds: The Target must make a Systems Save or only have line of sight to Adjacent Spaces until the end of their next turn.
  • Drowning Waters: The Target must make an Agility Save or become Immobilized until the end of their next turn.
  • Dismantling Fire: The Target must make an Engineering Save or take 2 burn every time they take an action or reaction until the end of their next turn.
  • Targets may be affected by more than one effect by this system but only one attack may apply one at a time.
